subject: RE: Newsletter sign up
preview: Hi Janina, Just letting you know that both of these newsletter forms now redirect to a 'thank you' page as requested by Practice Edge for SEO tracking purposes. So the confirmation message with the p

full_threads.body:
Hi Janina, 

Just letting you know that both of these newsletter forms now redirect to a 'thank you' page as requested by Practice Edge for SEO tracking purposes. So the confirmation message with the page is no longer required. Let us know if you require any other further tweaks though.
@heath noted, done updating the text color for RRPH  notif after the sign up. I think it's all good now.

@rica these will be having a separate confirmation page, so please hold, the messages will become redundant. 

Thanks

action.text: Rica Rosario Valencia assigned to Rica Rosario Valencia

full_threads.body:
Hi Rica,

The Disability Support & Accommodation link is approved.

As for RRPH, it seems that the update has caused the rest of the text to be white as well. Can you please amend?

Thank you,

Janina

JANINA HIPOLITO​

MARKETING SPECIALIST

D.

02 9808 9373

E.

Janina.Hipolito@royalrehab.com.au

Hi Janina, 

Hope all is well. Confirming we have now made the updates and they are ready for you to review. 

Please let us know if you would like any further changes.

action.text: Rica Rosario Valencia assigned to Rica Rosario Valencia

full_threads.body:
Hi Heath,

I tested these and they look good.

One thing, once I put my details through I'd like to change what's on the next 'part' of it.

Please see below what comes up on both after signing up:



Can we space out the "Sign up…" heading from the "From now…" message.

Can we edit the "From now you will receive…" message to "Thank you. You are now signed up to receive our newsletters!"

Can we also edit the font for the one on RRPH link to be white? It will be more visible in front of the purple background.

Thank you,

Janina

JANINA HIPOLITO​

MARKETING SPECIALIST

D.

02 9808 9373

E.

Janina.Hipolito@royalrehab.com.au

action.text: Rica Rosario Valencia assigned to Heath Maguire
Rica Rosario Valencia marked as Pending

full_threads.body:
Hi Trudy, 

Ok sure, we have made the updates:

  1. Added the checkboxes to the newsletter sign up form in the footer of the website 
  2. Added the newsletter to this page: https://royalrehab.com.au/private-hospital/
  3. Added the newsletter to this page:  https://royalrehab.com.au/disability-supports-and-accommodation/
Also, which system are you using for your edm's/blasts? We can potentially feed the new submissions into it automatically (depending on the platform being used).

Hi Heath,

Thanks for that. I think we should do option 1 with the choice to sign up to the Disability Services newsletter or the Royal Rehab Private Hospital / MetroRehab newsletter.

This could go on this page .

Also could we have a link to sign up on this page https://royalrehab.com.au/disability-supports-and-accommodation/ <https://royalrehab.com.au/disability-supports-and-accommodation/>, for the Disability Services newsletter linking to the newsletter sign up page?

And on this page https://royalrehab.com.au/private-hospital/ <https://royalrehab.com.au/private-hospital/> linking to the RRPH/Metro newsletter sign up page?

Kind regards,

Trudy.


TRUDY MCENEARNEY​

From: Heath Maguire <heath@wolfiq.com.au <mailto:heath@wolfiq.com.au>>
Sent: Tuesday, 30 June 2020 2:40 PM
To: Trudy McEnearney <Trudy.McEnearney@Royalrehab.com.au <mailto:Trudy.McEnearney@Royalrehab.com.au>>
Subject: Re: Newsletter sign up

Hi Trudy,

Ok there are two options for this:

Option 1 - Let them select

With this option we will add two check boxes under the name and email fields. The checkboxes enable the user to opt in to either or both newsletter.
Pros - you will have a refined list, that in theory will be more engaged

Option 2 - Subscribe to all

With the option we leave the newsletter as is and all subscribers will be added to both lists.
Pros - you will generate a larger list and potentially expose users to metro rehab as they may not have been aware of it as yet.

I’m leaning toward option 1, but I’m keen to get your thoughts?

Thanks and speak soon,
HEATH MAGUIRE
CREATIVE DIRECTOR - WOLFIQ.COM.AU <https://wolfiq.com.au/>
E. heath@wolfiq.com.au <mailto:heath@wolfiq.com.au> | P. 1300 072 134 | M. 0415 162 271

<https://wolfiq.com.au/>


On 29 Jun 2020, at 2:52 pm, Trudy McEnearney <Trudy.McEnearney@Royalrehab.com.au <mailto:Trudy.McEnearney@Royalrehab.com.au>> wrote:

Hi Heath,

I hope you had a good weekend. We are no longer having a RR newsletter, just one for RRPH/Metro and one for Disability Services.

We have a sign up on our website for RR newsletter.

What would you suggest we do now re the sign up method?

Could we change it to have the two newsletter options and promote them on the relevant pages?

Kind regards,

Trudy.
